Promoting Versioned Files to the Next Group

Once a milestone in the project lifecycle is complete, you can promote revisions to the next group in the promotion hierarchy. This option enforces the promotion model hierarchy assigned to your project database.

You can promote revisions to the next promotion group by selecting a revision, a single versioned file, multiple versioned files, a project, a folder, or a project database.

Using the System Default Options

Unless your Administrator changed the defaults for the project's configuration, when you promote a versioned file to the next level, Version Manager:

  • Moves the file from the first development group to the next promotion group in the hierarchy.
  • Does not reassign a promotion group across branches.
  • Does not include files in subprojects.

To promote files to the next group:

  1. Select the item you want to promote.

  2. Select Actions | Promotion Group | Promote. The Promote Group dialog box appears.

  3. Accept the defaults listed above and click OK, or do the following:

    1. To override the defaults on the General tab, edit any of the fields described below:

      To... Do this...
      Choose the promotion group from which the item will be promoted Select a promotion group from the Promote From list box.
      Allow reassignment of a promotion group across branches Select the OK to move across branches check box. Otherwise, the promotion will fail if a revision on another branch is already assigned the next highest promotion group.
      Promote all files in all subprojects Select the Include files in subprojects check box. This field is available only if the item you selected to promote is a project or project database.


    2. To review the selected files:

      To... Do this...
      View the items selected for promotion Click the Selected Files tab.
      View the properties of the items selected for promotion Select the item and click the Properties button.


  4. Click OK. The selected project or files are promoted to the next level.
